rocks.bastion.core.request

Class JsonRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • rocks.bastion.core.request.JsonRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Request

    public class JsonRequest
extends Object
implements Request
    A JSON request for use during Bastion tests. The JSON body is supplied either inline or from a JSON file on the classpath. Automatically sets the correct content type to use. This request will verify that the provided JSON body contains valid JSON.

    • Method Detail

      • fromString

        public static JsonRequest fromString(HttpMethod method,
                                     String url,
                                     String json)
                              throws InvalidJsonException
        Construct an HTTP request containing a JSON body from the given JSON string. Initially, the request will have the "application/json" HTTP header and no other additional headers and no query parameters. It will also have a descriptive name which is generated by combining the HTTP method with the URL.
        Parameters:
        method - The HTTP method to use for this request
        url - The URL to send this request on
        json - The JSON text to send as body content for this request
        Returns:
        An HTTP request containing the specified JSON body text
        Throws:
        InvalidJsonException - Thrown if the specified JSON text is not valid JSON text

                                  throws InvalidJsonException

Initially, the request will have the "application/json" HTTP header and no other additional headers and no query parameters. It will also have a descriptive name which is generated by combining the HTTP method with the URL.
        Parameters:
        url - The URL to send this request on
        json - The JSON text to send as body content for this request
        Returns:
        An HTTP request containing the specified JSON body text
        Throws:
        InvalidJsonException - Thrown if the specified JSON text is not valid JSON text

      • overrideContentType

        public JsonRequest overrideContentType(org.apache.http.entity.ContentType contentType)
        Override the content-type that will be used for this request. Initially, the content-type for a JSONRequest is "application/json" but you can override what is sent using this method.
        Parameters:
        contentType - A non-null content-type to use for this request
        Returns:
        This request (for method chaining)

      • contentType

        public org.apache.http.entity.ContentType contentType()
        Description copied from interface: Request
        The content type header to use for this request. This includes the MIME type of the content body, an optional character set of the request and other parameters, if necessary (such as quality parameter).
        Specified by:
        contentType in interface Request
        Returns:
        A non-null content type to use for this request

      • headers

        public Collection<ApiHeader> headers()
        Description copied from interface: Request
        A collection of HTTP headers that will be included with this request. Note that Bastion will automatically include the "Content-type" header using the value returned by Request.contentType() if, and only if, the collection returned by this method does not contain a header for "Content-type." This means that this method should not return a "Content-type" header as part of the collection unless you want to override the content-type returned by the Request.contentType() method.
        Specified by:
        headers in interface Request
        Returns:
        A non-null collection of HTTP header to include with the request

      • queryParams

        public Collection<ApiQueryParam> queryParams()
        Description copied from interface: Request
        A collection of HTTP query parameters that will be used for performing this request. Query parameters are typically appended to the end of an URL following a question mark symbol.
        Specified by:
        queryParams in interface Request
        Returns:
        A non-null collection of query parameters for this request

      • body

        public Object body()
        Description copied from interface: Request
        An object that will serve as a content body for this request. Can be null if this request will not send a body. Bastion may use the content-type of this request, returned by the Request.contentType() method, as well as the runtime type of the object returned by this method to determine how best to serialize the returned object into the HTTP request's body.
        Specified by:
        body in interface Request
        Returns:
        An object that will serve as the content body for this request. May be null.
